content.body: I missed this. Thanks for the ping!

@danielrosenwasser:matrix.org Can I convince you to reverse https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/51789? It’s trivial for you to implement, and prevents a lot of headache with https://github.com/tc39/proposal-string-dedent/issues/75
content.formatted_body: @danielrosenwasser Can I convince you to reverse https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/51789? It’s trivial for you to implement, and prevents a lot of headache with https://github.com/tc39/proposal-string-dedent/issues/75

content.body: I don't follow, we won't be emitting to ES5 in the next version of TS, so freezing behavior will be the default
Not everyone is going to immediately upgrade
This is the last chance to fix a headache before we have to get everyone to switch

We definitely can't change 5.9's behavior in a patch release, we don't plan on a 5.10, and 6.0 will have a min-target of ES2015. I wish we'd done it sooner already, but at this point if you need to use this library in ES5 the answer might be Babel for emit.

* We definitely can't change 5.9's behavior in a patch release, we don't plan on a 5.10, and 6.0 will have a min-target of ES2015. I wish we'd done it sooner, but at this point if you need to use this library in ES5 the answer might be Babel for emit.

m.new_content.body: We definitely can't change 5.9's behavior in a patch release, we don't plan on a 5.10, and 6.0 will have a min-target of ES2015. I wish we'd done it sooner, but at this point if you need to use this library in ES5 the answer might be Babel for emit.

content.body: it's going to be a language feature, not a library...
